column1: Tizi Ouzou or Thizi Wezzu (Berber: Tizi Wezzu or Thizi Wezzu
column2: ⵜⵉⵣⵉ ⵡⴻⵣⵓ) is a city in north central Algeria. It is among the largest cities in Algeria and is the capital and largest city of Tizi Ouzou Province. It is the second most populous city in the Kabylie region behind Béjaïa.

column1: The name comes from the Kabyle phrase Tizi Wezzu and is pronounced quickly Thiziwzzu
column2: commonly Tizi or Thizi which means the "mountain pass"
column3: while Azzu means the "Forsythia" (the preposition n / en
column6: hence the city is often referred to as "The gap of Forsythia".

column3: a Pentecostal church on 9 January 2010. The pastor was quoted as saying that worshipers fled when local police left a gang of local rioters unchecked.

column1: This city is located in the heart of Kabylie. It is 102.36 square kilometres (39.52 sq mi) in area. Tizi Ouzou is located in the valley of Assif N Sébaou. It is surrounded by mountains. The city is at an altitude of 200 metres (660 ft). It is bounded on the north by Mount Belloua which rises to 850 metres (2
column2: 790 ft) above sea level. A portion of the old city of Tizi Ouzou (known as the High City) backed the east slopes of the mountain. At the top of the mountain Belloua lies the village of Redjaouna. The latter is attached to the town of Tizi Ouzou.

column1: Tizi Ouzou experiences a hot Mediterranean climate (Köppen climate classification Csa).
The local professional football team is JS Kabylie.
Mouloud Mammeri University of Tizi-Ouzou is the local university. There are three campuses: Campus Hasnaoua I
